name: Lesser - Known Disney Songs Online Trivia | For Children | 10 Questions

questions.text: Though "Bella Notte" and "The Siamese Cat Song" are the most remembered songs from "Lady an the Tramp", this song, the first heard, was considered so pretty it was used as the finale as well.
questions.explanation:
Peace On Earth.

	This song was sung during the opening Christmas scene, and again during the end credits.

questions.text: This is probably the most famous song cut from the final version of a Disney film. A lot of people seem to know this song even though the lyrics were never in the movie "Peter Pan"- just the music. Which musical theme do we hear without lyrics?
options: Yo Ho, A Pirate's Life For Me
questions.explanation:
Never Smile At a Crocodile.

	"I Won't Grow Up" is from the Broadway (non-Disney) version of "Peter Pan".

questions.text: Which song is sung by Geppetto after he finishes painting Pinocchio?
options: Turn On the Old Music Box
questions.explanation:
Little Wooden Head.

	Both "Little Wooden Head" and "Music Box" are easily recognizable and can be heard on the clocks and music boxes in Geppetto's workshop.

questions.text: "Cinderella" has a lot of very memorable songs. Which not-so-familiar song is sung first by one of the ugly stepsisters and then by Cinderella herself?
questions.explanation:
O Sing Sweet Nightingale.

	"Middle of a Muddle" was a song written for the film but not used. "Sing a Smiling Song" was written for "Sleeping Beauty" but not used. "Fortuosity" is from "The Happiest Millionaire".

questions.text: One of the reasons for the box office failure of "Alice in Wonderland" has been attributed to the lack of memorable songs. In fact, the film is filled with the most songs of any Disney feature, most of them being only a couple of lines long. Which is not a song from the film?
questions.explanation:
Bill the Lizard.

	Other songs from the film are "A E I O U", "Painting the Roses Red", "All in the Golden Afternoon", "The Walrus and the Carpenter", "You Are Old, Father William", and "How Do You Do, and Shake Hands." Contrary to thought, the familar song "I'm Late, I'm Late, For a Very Important Date" is not heard in the film, though the lines are spoken by the White Rabbit.

questions.text: Which of the following films does not have the title of the film as a song?
questions.explanation:
Lady and the Tramp.

	It is interesting that the opening theme songs are usually the least familiar. Can you sing the lyrics to any of the above songs?

questions.text: What is the song heard during the opening credits of Peter Pan?
questions.correct: The Second Star To the Right
options: You Can Fly, You Can Fly, You Can Fly
Yo Ho, A Pirate's Life For Me
questions.explanation: The Second Star To the Right.

questions.text: Which film is the following lyric from: "Fate is kind. It brings to those who mind, the sweet fulfillment of their secret longing?"
questions.explanation:
Pinocchio.

	This is the bridge to "When You Wish Upon a Star". It is beyond ironic that, while this film was being shown in America, millions of people were being killed in concentration camps in Europe. Try telling them that "fate is kind"!

questions.text: All the songs from Bambi have one central motif in common. What theme pervades ALL the songs?
questions.explanation:
Music.

	The all revolve around music. The songs are "Love is a Song", "Let's Sing a Gay Little Spring Song", "I Bring You a Song", and "Little April Shower" which contains the lines "...beating a tune as you fall all around....come with your beautiful music."

questions.text: Finally, can you name just ONE song from "The Rescuers"? Which of these was NOT one of those?
questions.explanation:
Help Is On the Way.

	The other song is "Rescue Aid Society", but that was too obvious.
